comments:
Build ID: I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Install Eclipse 3.3 and TPTP 4.4.0.1
2. Open a project that uses the TPTP static analysis and overwrite the getOwnedElements() method in your provider class like this:

To add a category at runtime:

	private static boolean bFirstRun = true;
	public List getOwnedElements() {
		if (bFirstRun) {
			DefaultAnalysisCategory cat = new DefaultAnalysisCategory();
			cat.setLabel("Dynamically added Category");
			cat.setIconName(getIconName());
			addOwnedElement(cat);
			bFirstRun = false;
		}
		return super.getOwnedElements();
	}

To add a rule at runtime:

	private static boolean bFirstRun = true;
	public List getOwnedElements() {
		if (bFirstRun) {
			for (Object o : super.getOwnedElements()) {
				DefaultAnalysisCategory cat = (DefaultAnalysisCategory)o;
				// This is a category defined using "plugin.xml"
				if (cat.getLabel().compareTo("User-defined Rules") == 0) {
					// The Rule class is just a stub that extends AbstractAnalysisRule
					Rule rule = new Rule();
					rule.setLabel("Dynamically added rule");
					rule.setIconName(getIconName());
					cat.addOwnedElement(rule);
				}
			}
			bFirstRun = false;
		}
		return super.getOwnedElements();
	}

3. Start the app to run an anaylsis, open the rules tab of the analysis dialog and then you will get the added error traces.

In the case of adding a category at runtime:

http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/tptp-platform-dev/msg02021.html
Steve, please see if you can contain this defect in 441. Thx
(In reply to comment #0)

The reason you are getting these NULL pointer exception is that you did not set the ID on the category or the rule

For example if i change the dynamic category code you had to look like this 

	public List getOwnedElements() {
        if (bFirstRun) {
                DefaultAnalysisCategory cat = new
                	DefaultAnalysisCategory();
                cat.setLabel("Dynamically added Category");
                cat.setIconName(getIconName());
                cat.setId("Some Id generated");
                addOwnedElement(cat);
                bFirstRun = false;
        }
        return super.getOwnedElements();
	}

Every thing will work fine, notice that the only difference calling setId on cat, the same thing apply to the rule


Attached an image showing your category displayed correctly after the change

Created an attachment (id=76711)
Screen capture

As per Mohammed's note when you create categories (or any other type of analysis element) they must have a unique id.  Most categories in the TPTP code typical use an ID of the form "codereview.java.<categoryName>" but you can use anything string you want as long as it doesn't collide with any other category id's.  I'd suggest you create your own namespace such as "web.de.<myCategory>"
Hi all,

Yes, adding the ID did the trick. I thought I already tried that, 
but obviously I didn't... :-\  Thanks for your help!

I question regarding this remains: How can I replace the red square
(look at the screenshot) with the correct image? I tried the following:

Then I copied the file "analysiscategory_obj.gif" to my icons directory
of my plugin but I still see the red square.

Thanks and bye, Jens
(In reply to comment #5)


Add these 2 lines and you should see the normal icon instead of the red square

                cat.setIconName(AnalysisConstants.ICON_CATEGORY);
                cat.setPluginId(AnalysisCorePlugin.getPluginId());

Hi Mohammed,

Thanks for your fast help. Now it's working find. Here is the final code:


private static boolean bFirstRun = true;
public List getOwnedElements() {
	if (bFirstRun) {
		// Add a category
		DefaultAnalysisCategory category = 
			new DefaultAnalysisCategory();
		category.setLabel("Dynamically added Category");
		category.setId(
			"de.ugoe.cs.swe.trex.xaf.category.dynamicCategory1");
		category.setIconName(AnalysisConstants.ICON_CATEGORY);
		category.setPluginId(AnalysisCorePlugin.getPluginId());
		addOwnedElement(category);
		
		// The Rule class extends AbstractAnalysisRule
		Rule rule = new Rule();
		rule.setLabel("Dynamically added rule");
		rule.setIconName(AnalysisConstants.ICON_RULE);
		rule.setPluginId(AnalysisCorePlugin.getPluginId());
		rule.setId("de.ugoe.cs.swe.trex.xaf.category.dynamicRule1");
		// Add a rule to the category
		category.addOwnedElement(rule);
		
		bFirstRun = false;
	}
	return super.getOwnedElements();
}


Bye, Jens
